markdownRemark.html:
This is a project born out of frustration over the years in the hobby. Every time I step into a store there seems to be a new species I have never heard of or seen before. A cursory glance at Google reveals a conglomerate of websites with contradictory and incomplete information. Most of the top results are from garbage websites. I think what irks me the most is there's no site where I can properly scroll through a visual library of species. Few species properly express their colors until all stressors have been removed, which makes it seem silly most people select fish based upon appearances.

Would be pretty sweet to have a website I can browse fish by appearance, select the ones I like, get accurate data, track endangered species, converse with hobbyists and researchers, and use the image data to feed neural networks that can be used in ROVs to identify populations in the wild. After having been in this hobby for years and a love for the world beneath the waves, I needed it to start meaning something.

frontmatter.title: The Open Source Aquatic Library
frontmatter.summary: Creating an online visual library of the world's aquatic species
